item.title: [SPR-2909] Hibernate 3.2.1; HibernateException No local DataSource found for configuration when schemaUpdate is true
item.description:

item.summary: Hibernate 3.2.1; HibernateException No local DataSource found for configuration when schemaUpdate is true

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I do not know nearly enough about these classes to comment, but I'm going to anyway, so please pardon my ignorance.

Here is what I see happening:

  • AbstractSessionFactoryBean#afterPropertiesSet invokes LocalSessionFactoryBean#buildSessionFactory
  • LocalSessionFactoryBean#buildSessionFactory sets its configTimeDataSourceHolder field, but clears it again before it returns
  • AbstractSessionFactoryBean#afterPropertiesSet then invokes LocalSessionFactoryBean#afterSessionFactoryCreation, which in turn invokes LocalSessionFactoryBean#updateDatabaseSchema if LocalSessionFactoryBean#schemaUpdate is true
  • LocalSessionFactoryBean#updateDatabaseSchema leads to an invocation of LocalDataSourceConnectionProvider#configure, where the exception listed above is thrown because LocalSessionFactoryBean#configTimeDataSourceHolder is null

So, unless there is something in LocalSessionFactoryBean#buildSessionFactory that is supposed to trigger a LocalDataSourceConnectionProvider#configure invocation while LocalSessionFactoryBean#configTimeDataSourceHolder is set, the schema update will never work.

I wrote this ugly work around that does the update while LocalSessionFactoryBean#configTimeDataSourceHolder is still set:

import java.sql.Connection;
import java.sql.SQLException;

import org.hibernate.HibernateException;
import org.hibernate.Session;
import org.hibernate.SessionFactory;
import org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration;
import org.hibernate.dialect.Dialect;
import org.hibernate.tool.hbm2ddl.DatabaseMetadata;
import org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.LocalSessionFactoryBean;

/**

  • Hack that circumvents Spring bug http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/spring/browse/SPR-2909?page=all
  • to accomplish schema update. Once the Spring bug is fixed, this class should
  • no longer be used.
    */
    public class HackLocalSessionFactoryBean extends LocalSessionFactoryBean
    {
    @Override
    protected SessionFactory newSessionFactory(Configuration config) throws HibernateException
    Unknown macro: { try { SessionFactory result = super.newSessionFactory(config); Session session = result.openSession(); Connection con = session.connection(); Dialect dialect = Dialect.getDialect(getConfiguration().getProperties()); DatabaseMetadata metadata = new DatabaseMetadata(con, dialect); String[] sql = getConfiguration().generateSchemaUpdateScript(dialect, metadata); executeSchemaScript(con, sql); session.close(); return result; } catch (SQLException e) { throw new HibernateException(e); } }

    }

Thanks for pointing this out! We need to expose the DataSource for the schema update as well there, which has been addressed in Spring 2.0.2 now. However, this requirement seems to be new in Hibernate 3.2.1: In previous versions, Hibernate's schema export did not require access to the DataSource there, but rather simply operated on the given Connection...

Please give the next nightly snapshot (http://www.springframework.org/snapshots) a try and let me know whether it works for you...

Juergen
